channel.title: Brandon Boswell
channel.description: Recent content from Brandon Boswell's Digital Garden

item.title: Homework for Life
item.description: Author: Matthew Dicks URL: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=x7p329Z8MD0 Storytelling is about connecting with people. “If I had to tell a 5-minute story from something that happened today, What would it be?” What was the most story-like moment?
item.content:encoded:
• Author: Matthew Dicks
  • URL: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=x7p329Z8MD0

Storytelling is about connecting with people.

“If I had to tell a 5-minute story from something that happened today, What would it be?”

What was the most story-like moment? What makes today different from the last day?

Just writing a few sentences from that moment can bring you right back to that moment on a future date.

Daily Reflection

item.title: Raycast
item.description: It seems like Alfred with a better UI. The fact that it has good Figma and Github support makes it interesting to me, but I haven’t found a good way to support Launch anything on your Mac with Alfred without having to think about is it a bookmark or not.
item.content:encoded: It seems like Alfred with a better UI. The fact that it has good Figma and Github support makes it interesting to me, but I haven’t found a good way to support Launch anything on your Mac with Alfred without having to think about is it a bookmark or not.

item.title: Meta Work
item.description: Meta work is the work that happens before and after the work itself
item.content:encoded: Meta work is the work that happens before and after the work itself

item.title: Find time away from screens
item.description: This is something I need to do a better job with. I do a very good job of this when we go camping with Marshie’s family each summer, and I don’t use my phone or computer whatsoever.
item.content:encoded: This is something I need to do a better job with. I do a very good job of this when we go camping with Marshie’s family each summer, and I don’t use my phone or computer whatsoever. I should find specific daily and weekly routines where I am not in front of any screens.

item.title: Handwritten notes are a form of short-term memory
item.description: Analog
item.content:encoded: Analog

item.title: Review your past work
item.description: This is something I have historically been bad at. I am typically in consume, consume, consume mode, but rarely take the time to review what I’ve consumed or created. I’ve tried to become more conscious of this recently by doing weekly and annual reflection.
item.content:encoded:
This is something I have historically been bad at. I am typically in consume, consume, consume mode, but rarely take the time to review what I’ve consumed or created. I’ve tried to become more conscious of this recently by doing weekly and annual reflection.

Weekly Reflection Annual Review

item.title: We are poor judges of ourselves in realtime
item.description: It is important that we take time to review our past work for many reasons. Firstly to see how far we’ve come, but secondly because we may realize something about our performance that we were blind to at that moment and the moments shortly thereafter.
item.content:encoded:
It is important that we take time to review our past work for many reasons. Firstly to see how far we’ve come, but secondly because we may realize something about our performance that we were blind to at that moment and the moments shortly thereafter. If we never review our past thoughts, we may miss out on having this introspection and the opportunity to grow from it.

Review your past work

My Notes & Thoughts

Concepts

  • Borrowed Creativity
  • Boredom breeds creativity

Resources

  • My Phone is Ruining My Creativity

item.title: We are poor judges of how innovative our ideas are
item.description: Early into a specific field we feel we are doing innovative things that are not novel or new. As we spend more time with a field we feel like we are being less innovative, but are actually being more innovative.
item.content:encoded:
Early into a specific field we feel we are doing innovative things that are not novel or new. As we spend more time with a field we feel like we are being less innovative, but are actually being more innovative. We are poor judges of how innovative our ideas are. This is another form of the Curse of Knowledge.

References

Being intimately familiar with something enables us to be playful with it, to modify it, to spot new and different ideas without running the risk of merely repeating old ideas believing they are new. — How to Take Smart Notes

item.title: Super Duper Keyboard
item.description: https://github.com/jasonrudolph/keyboard Written by Jason Rudolph I don’t use this directly as parts of it I don’t need, but this was a huge inspiration for what I run as my Karabiner and Hammerspoon configs.
item.content:encoded:
https://github.com/jasonrudolph/keyboard

Written by Jason Rudolph

I don’t use this directly as parts of it I don’t need, but this was a huge inspiration for what I run as my Karabiner and Hammerspoon configs.

Key aspects for me:

  • Super Duper Mode
    • HJKL arrows
      • with good support for jumping back and forward a word by holding A, as well as selection support by holding space bar.
    • Easy Tab Switching in Chrome and Obsidian with YUIO
    • Alt + H to delete previous word
    • Alt + L to delete next word

item.title: Fully Jarvis Desk

item.title: Whoever best describes the problem is the one most likely to solve it
item.description: Whoever best describes the problem is the one most likely to solve it. From The Personal MBA by Josh Kaufman Whoever best describes the problem is the one most likely to solve it
item.content:encoded:
Whoever best describes the problem is the one most likely to solve it. From The Personal MBA by Josh Kaufman Whoever best describes the problem is the one most likely to solve it

It is difficult to solve a problem you can’t describe. Take the time to write out the problem you’re trying to solve to validate that you truly understand what you’re trying to solve. This is especially helpful when scoping a problem. Define the problem

item.title: 60-30-10 Color Rule
item.description: Proposes that your color usage should break down to 60% of Viewport is in your neutral color 30% is in your brand or primary color 10% is in your accent/call-to-action color
item.content:encoded:
Proposes that your color usage should break down to 60% of Viewport is in your neutral color 30% is in your brand or primary color 10% is in your accent/call-to-action color

For Dorsata our neutral is the grey background 30% is our white area’s we’re asking folks to focus their attention on 10% is our deep green for actionable areas.

References

  • Author: Jesse Showalter
  • URL: https://youtu.be/UWwNIMHFdW4

item.title: Define the problem
item.description: “The more precisely you define the problem, the more easily you can find a solution. “I feel bad” can have a million causes. “I didn’t sleep much last night and I haven’t exercised in a week” has a very straightforward answer.
item.content:encoded:
“The more precisely you define the problem, the more easily you can find a solution. “I feel bad” can have a million causes. “I didn’t sleep much last night and I haven’t exercised in a week” has a very straightforward answer.”

Five Whys

item.description: “Someone who adores an endeavor.”
item.content:encoded: “Someone who adores an endeavor.”

item.title: Range Why Generalists Triumph in a Specialized World
item.description: Generalists are more adaptable than specialists, obviously. Creativity has never been more important because computers are augmenting the human mind to take over the more logic driven decision-making. The creative aspect is the key differentiator that makes human thought still critical.
item.content:encoded: Generalists are more adaptable than specialists, obviously. Creativity has never been more important because computers are augmenting the human mind to take over the more logic driven decision-making. The creative aspect is the key differentiator that makes human thought still critical. Amateur - Someone who adores an endeavor.

item.title: Wordle
item.description: Wordle has been great as it has reconnected me with my best friend. Wordle has given us a connection point each day when we chat over text message. Two key aspects are that there is only one each day and that everyone is working on the same one.
item.content:encoded: Wordle has been great as it has reconnected me with my best friend. Wordle has given us a connection point each day when we chat over text message. Two key aspects are that there is only one each day and that everyone is working on the same one. The limited manner gives each guess more weight and also ensures people don’t binge it and grow tired of it. The fact everyone is working on the same puzzle is what adds to the social element of the game.

item.title: Wordle Starting Words
item.description: I first started with BIOME to rule out three vowels, I have since moved to REACH because it aligns with more common character combinations. Alternatively, I could try TEACH as it would allow me to rule out the TH combinations.
item.content:encoded: I first started with BIOME to rule out three vowels, I have since moved to REACH because it aligns with more common character combinations. Alternatively, I could try TEACH as it would allow me to rule out the TH combinations.

item.title: Boredom breeds creativity
item.description: This is likely why some of my best ideas come while in the shower without my phone, or in the car driving.
item.content:encoded: This is likely why some of my best ideas come while in the shower without my phone, or in the car driving.

item.title: Don't check your phone for the first hour you wake
item.description: Each morning is an opportunity to go make or work on what you love. You can even do that before you go to your job. By keeping a safe distance from your phone in the morning, you are in full control of that time.
item.content:encoded:
Each morning is an opportunity to go make or work on what you love. You can even do that before you go to your job. By keeping a safe distance from your phone in the morning, you are in full control of that time. Use this time to build what you want before any nasty surprises have an opportunity to arrive.

Checking your phone is inviting surprises and distractions Protected Time

References

item.title: Willpower is a finite resource
item.description: Interestingly, Khe Hy uses parental controls on his phone to block all social sites and news (presumably to conserve willpower) References Atomic Habits My Week Without Email and Slack RadReads
item.content:encoded:
Interestingly, Khe Hy uses parental controls on his phone to block all social sites and news (presumably to conserve willpower)
